properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 10 at 9:27AM CST until February 10 at 12:30PM CST by NWS Jackson MS
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a

* Flash Flood Warning for...
Leake County in central Mississippi...

* Until 1230 PM CST.

* At 926 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing
heavy rain across the warned area. Up to two to three inches of
rain have already fallen. Flash flooding is expected to begin
shortly.

HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas,
highways, streets and underpasses as well as other
drainage and low lying areas.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Carthage, Edinburg, Renfroe, Singleton, Thomastown and Redwater.

Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the
warned area through this morning.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

CMAMtext: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 12:30 PM CST. Avoid flooded areas.
